text: Singapore was the host of the inaugural 2010 Summer Youth Olympics. It participated in all the 26 sports, with a total of 129 athletes representing the nation. ==Medalists== Medals awarded to participants of mixed-NOC (Combined) teams are represented in italics. These medals are not counted towards the individual NOC medal tally. Singapore medalists: {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:90%" |- ! Medal ! Name ! Sport ! Event ! Date |- | || || Swimming || Youth Men's 50m Backstroke || 18 Aug |- | || || Table tennis || Women's Singles || 23 Aug |- | || || Taekwondo || Men's 55kg || 16 Aug |- | || || Taekwondo || Women's 55kg || 16 Aug |- | ' || ' || Archery || Mixed team || 19 Aug |- | || || Sailing || Windsurfing (Techno 293) || 25 Aug |- | || || Football || Boys' tournament || 25 Aug |} == Archery== The Republic's Abdul Dayyan and Turkey's Begunhan Elif Unsal won the bronze medal playoff in the mixed team event, which was held at the Kallang Field on Thursday. Needing a perfect score of 20, they beat Bangladesh's Mohamed Emdadul Haque Milon and Spain's Miriam Alarcón 20–19 in the tie-breaking set. Tan secured Singapore's first medal at the YOG, winning bronze in the Boys' Under-55 kg taekwondo event at the Suntec International Convention Centre. Kaveh Rezaei of Iran, the World Junior champion, won 12 – 0.http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/sportsnews/view/1075510/1/.html Suntec International Convention Centre, Tuesday, August 17, 2010 — Shafinas Abdul Rahman secured a bronze — Singapore’s second medal at the Games — after losing her bout to Nguyen Thanh Thao of Vietnam in the women’s 55 kg Taekwondo semi-final.http://redsports.sg/2010/08/17/shafinas-youth-olympics-bronze- medal-taekwondo/ {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left; font-size:90%" !Athlete !Event !Preliminary !Quarterfinal
